name: Hobbit Hollow B&B

reviews.title: Relaxing and sweet
reviews.text: This was a gift from friends when my husband was home on R&R from Iraq. It was a wonderful place for a reconnect and enjoy each other during the short period we were together. We appreciated the quietness of the area. We went to the Sherwood Inn for dinner - a wonderful choice. Not much in walking distance to the Inn but a short drive brought you to downtown Skaneateles. Very beautiful.

reviews.title: Beautiful B&B – A Long Way From The Lake
reviews.text: We chose this B&B because the Sherwood Inn which is located right in Skaneateles was full. This is one of their other properties just 2 miles outside town. The inn boasts sweeping views of Lake Skaneateles saying that it is just across the road from the lake. What they failed to mention is that parallel lake road is about a half mile from the Lake and that there is a vineyard between the farm house, the road and the lake so while you can see the lake – it is a long way away. This was the biggest disappointment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B itself is beautiful and the staff is friendly and helpful. We upgraded to stay in the Lake View Room which was $230/night for 3 nights. Had we known just how far away the lake was, we would have stayed in one of the much cheaper rooms because you still get all the amenities and views around the farm house. Plus if you want to see the lake in the distance, they have a screened in porch at the front of the house where you can sit and relax. The lake view rooms are just not a good value in my opinion. The room itself and the en-suite bathroom were quite large and had lots of amenities like thick terry bathrobes, spa products and an in-room TV. It was furnished with antique furniture and the bedding included high end $800 Frette sheets. They must have a problem with their washer though because we noticed that the sheets and some of the fluffy towels had holes that looked as though they got caught in the washer.
reviews.title: Superb Accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The common rooms feature gorgeous furniture as well as things to do such as TV’s, games and high speed internet access. Wine, cookies, cheese, bottled water and other drinks are complimentary and easily available by asking the hostess or getting them from the refrigerator. Breakfasts were fantastic and included selections such as fresh fruit, local granola, blueberry stuffed French toast (they used croissants for the bread), vegetable frittata with ham on the side and traditional French toast with fruit.
reviews.title: Charming & Elegant Retreat

reviews.text: My wife and I spent our honeymoon week touring the Finger Lakes Region. We looked for B&Bs that were elegant but not outrageously priced. We checked on Hobbit Hollow online, saw the reviews here and booked it. The house is tucked away from the Lake on a quiet hillside. The interior is immaculate and well-decorated with fine antiques. Our room was quite spacious and the bathroom was large and clean. The Hostess gave us several recommendations for dinner and prepared a delicious breakfast the next morning. Being only a few minutes from the heart of town, the property was still very secluded, quiet and romantic. It was the best B&B that we stayed at on our trip (5 inns total). We would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a romantic getaway.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night 2-21-11 and there were 2 other couples sharing the Home. Our "deal" came with $50.00 dinner credit at Sherwood Inn.
reviews.title: Winter Palace on the lake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This house it architecturally beautiful. I have posted photos which speak better than words. Been to more than a few B&Bs and here we felt at ease and at home..
reviews.title: Very Lovely

reviews.text: Maureen, the innkeeper, was friendly and very accommodating (wine/beer was for the asking). The location was short drive (in summer would make a nice walk, but the temp was in the teens) to town.
reviews.title: Tolkien would be delighted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival there was the wonderful smell of cookies. We took tour of the house and found out large room with bathroom with Shower and separate tub. The house has a split living room are and a small library well stocked with a variety of book, So if the house is full it seem there would be places to be aside by yourself if wanted.
reviews.title: Wonderfully restful and close to town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was delicious and the scones (prepared by Maureen, using a secret recipe) were amazing.
reviews.title: Relaxing Thanksgiving

reviews.text: Maybe the wealthy investor hired a new innkeeper. This one is helpful but not at all intrusive.
reviews.title: Looking forward to our return

reviews.text: We stayed over for our anniversary and had the Masters Suite..with a gas fireplace,a double whirlpool and an enclosed porch.
reviews.title: Quiet, relaxing, fun inn-keeper

reviews.text: I am not too big into the decorative touches but it seemed just fine to me..We spent most of our time in the room,anyway and the room was lovely. We could see the lake from the veranda,where we sat and sipped wine in the afternoon.
reviews.title: Beautiful but hollow...
Heavenly At Hobbitt Hollow Farms
reviews.text: Breakfast was well prepared and very good.

description: Located on top a rolling hill and rising above colorful meadows, Hobbit Hollow offers sweeping views of vineyards and Skaneateles Lake, the Eastern Gateway to the Finger Lakes Region of Central New York. Hobbit Hollow is a turn of the century Colonial Revival farmhouse featuring five elegant and comfortable guest rooms, each uniquely appointed with master-crafted period furniture including four-poster beds, antique accessories, exquisite linens and private baths.
